definition: to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted

old variant of 話|话[hua4]

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
old variant of 話|话[hua4]

sentences.english: BE careful in reading G. B. Shaw. He often had his tongue in his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 读肖伯纳的作品时得注意，他的文章经常话里有话。

sentences.english: Otherwise you wouldn't put an alternate meaning Behind everything you say.
sentences.chinese: 不然你也不会这么话里有话了。

definition: overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
overtone (music)/(fig.) connotation/implied meaning
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
eccentric/peculiar/mystifying
to talk in riddles
lit. a needle concealed in silk floss (idiom)/fig. ruthless character behind a gentle appearance/a wolf in sheep's clothing/an iron fist in a velvet glove
see 弦外之音[xian2 wai4 zhi1 yin1]
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
irony/ironic remark
unspoken dialogue in a play, left for the audience to infer/subtext/(fig.) implicit assertion
to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
